page.title: 06Trade in S'key & C'thorpe.
page.content:
Most trade in and out of Stiffkey and Cockthorpe is agricultural. No railway or port, road transport used. Sea-farming provides mainly local market. Some retail trade.
{Exports:}wheat for milling; barley for malting (via Wells port); sugar beet used to go to London, now goes to British Sugar Corporation at Kings Lynn; potatoes to Yorkshire for crisps; other exports include field beans for feed, peas for processing, carrots, wool; bullock and lamb for slaughter; produce of sea-farming. {Imports:} supplementary barley for feed, fish-meal for fertiliser. {Retail trade:} village shop provides daily consumer needs; small antique and reproduction trade with specialisation in lamps.
